title: 108_s2877
content: The "Taxpayer-Teacher Protection Act of 2004" reduces the special allowance for loans from tax-exempt issues. Section 438(b)(2)(B) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to adjust the special allowance rates for loans issued between specific dates. The special allowance rates for loans made with certain funds are adjusted under the Higher Education Act of 1965. The special allowance rates for eligible loans made or purchased with specified funds are adjusted under the Higher Education Act of 1965. These loans must meet certain criteria, such as being financed by matured obligations or being refinanced between October 1, 2004, and October 1, 2005. The special allowance rates for eligible loans made or purchased with specified funds are adjusted under the Higher Education Act of 1965. Funds obtained from a source other than those described in the clause or sold/transferred to another holder between October 1, 2004, and October 1, 2005, are excluded. SEC. 3. LOAN FORGIVENESS FOR TEACHERS. Implementing Highly Qualified Teacher Requirements by amending sections of the Higher Education Act of 1965 to ensure that elementary and secondary school teachers are highly qualified as defined in the Elementary Secondary Education Act of 1965. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to ensure that elementary and secondary school teachers are highly qualified as defined in the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965. The transition rule prevents disqualification of individuals who started service before the enactment of this Act. The Act ensures that teachers meet qualification requirements as defined in the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965. A rule exempts individuals who started service before the Act's enactment. Additional amounts are eligible for repayment for teachers in mathematics. The Act ensures teachers meet qualification requirements under the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965. Additional repayment amounts up to $17,500 are available for teachers in mathematics, science, or special education. The Act provides additional repayment amounts for special education teachers who work with children with disabilities, as certified by their school's chief administrative officer. The Act offers additional loan cancellation amounts for teachers in mathematics, science, or special education, with a maximum of $17,500 for secondary school teachers who meet specific requirements. Teachers in mathematics, science, or special education can qualify for additional loan cancellation amounts under the Act, with a maximum of $17,500 for secondary school teachers meeting specific requirements. The amendments made by this subsection apply to eligible individuals who are new borrowers on or after October 1, 1998, and before October. New borrowers eligible from October 1, 1998 to October 1, 2005.
